thread.text: Hi, welcome to the forums! Have you already tried to force reboot holding the Power button for about 15 seconds? Can you boot your phone in safe mode?
holding for 15 seconds restarts it but not into safe mode. no change with a re-boot. just noticed that notifications are no longer appearing either?
To boot into safe mode press the power button and then long press on the Power Off window.
in safe mode the same issues are still there. happy to try any suggestions

Have you recently received the Marshmallow update or are you still running Lollipop? The safe mode practically ruled out a conflict with a third party app, but just in case, do you remember installing or updating any app right before the problems started? 
There's a couple of things to try before a factory reset. 
- Go to settings - apps - three dots top right and reset app preferences. 
- Settings - storage - cached data - clear. 
- Wipe the cache partition on recovery. The steps are a bit different depending on the Android version. 
- Restart the phone. 
Make sure to backup anything you don't want to lose just in case a factory reset is necessary.

yes it updated to marshmallow two weeks ago. 
ok tried all of those steps and still no luck...  guessing only step left is the reset?

Looks that way 
Just a couple more things. 
- settings - security - device administrators. What is it checked in there? 
- Are you using any battery booster, cleaner app or RAM optimizer? If so, disable them or even uninstall. I've seen some people having very funny issues with this kind of apps. 
- You are using the stock launcher, right? Would you like trying a custom one and see if anything changes? Some of your issues seem launcher related. Nova would be my first option. 
I'm running from place to place today  I'll let you know if I find something else later on.

android device manager is checked (also its the only thing in that menu).
Not using a battery booster. ok i will try a different launcher.
thanks for help so far

replies.text: Look at the links in some of the previous posts in this thread. The post numbers have changed because Mods have deleted a number of empty posts (where people simply quote another person and don't add anything else).

thread.text:
Install Nova Launcher
Create a "Activities Shortcut" Widget
Select "Setup Wizard" then under that select ".SetupExitActivity"
Tap the widget you've just created 
Done

I had exactly same problem on my Moto X Play. I was running out of space and I used to get alert all the time. 2 days back my phone restarted just like that and after that notif. drawer, home and recent apps buttons stopped working. 
I could not even factory reset phone via Settings, that button was disabled. So, I searched through and got this video (

) and got to know how you hard reset Moto X Play. I got into recovery mode and wiped data/factory reset. All back to normal now! 
Hope it helps

title: OK Google is off yet activating randomly!

thread.text: My wife has a Moto X Play and hotword detection is off. Yet almost everyday she takes her phone and there's a Google search of something we said. Very very annoying. How do I make sure this doesn't happen?
Is it possible that the phone is accidentally being turned on while in her pocket or purse, and then the microphone on the Google search bar widget is being accidentally pressed?

replies.text: No it's usually while lying on a counter.

thread.text: Any phantom touches? Maybe the screen near the microphone is falsely registering a touch.

replies.text: No it's generally surrounded by either nothing or books and paper.

thread.text: Sorry, I meant do you ever notice other unintended touches during your routine usage? Phantom touches don't need anything nearby to register -- it might be a problem with the screen, or perhaps a screen protector.

replies.text: She says it doesn't happen. We just tried saying OK Google (with my voice and hers) and it launched. This is bizarre.

thread.text: What if you clear the Google app's cache and data?

thread.text: Try wiping the cache partition first, if you haven't already: https://motorola-mobility-en-in.cust...p/30,6720,9392

thread.text: It just seems like something is wrong. Send some feedback to Google via the Feedback option in the Google app's settings. Also send feedback to Lenovo, if there's an option to do that in the phone's system settings.

title: Moto X Play is completely and utterly broken, cannot access phone

thread.text:
Hello, I cannot access my phone at all and it is driving me insane
Some context, a lot of Moto X Play phones have this thing where once the internal storage gets full, the phone goes crazy, the navigation buttons don't work, you can't swipe down for the notification bar, you can't receive or make calls.
I read of a fix that involved using Nova launcher, and using the Activities widget to link SetupWizardTestActivity which opens the Set up wizard and usually fixes the phone
However I've stupidly let my phone get full again and this method has stopped working for me. I am completely stuck in the phone 'welcome' setup loop and cannot get into my phone at all.
What happens is I press next once selecting my language, then I get onto the Wifi setup page which can only be skipped if you have a mobile connection working. This setup process cannot be done with no connection. If I press skip/have a SIM in, it gives me the privacy page which I accept, then puts me on the Add your Google account page. Now if I type in my account, it tells me 'This account already exists on your device'. If I try to make a new one, it leads me through some pages and eventually tells me I must sign in with the account I used when I first set up the phone, which it does not let me. 
If I skip the Google account setup page, it just loops me back onto the Privacy page.
I've tried it in safe mode, I've tried wiping the cache partition, I'm not factory resetting the phone. 
Thanks to whoever can help me.

if you don't have any important files in the phone than do hard reset. When device is turned off press power button and volume down button notification comes.
check it in Google search how to hard reset Moto x play.
Don't keep internal storage full later on

thread.text:
I have just purchased moto x play. but this phone has overheating problem even after 10-15 minutes of call. heating is too much that phone can not be kept with ear to attend the call. Motorola must release any update to resolve this problem ASAP otherwise this phone is totally wastage of money.

replies.text: Even i bought new through flipkart offer time. Waste of money. With 15 minutes of Skype it gets too much overheated Nd hangs off. Ridiculous after spending 18000.almost.. it's a lesson not to buy at first release

thread.text:
A new phone can get a bit warmer sometimes on the first days of use. This is normal, the whole system needs to settle down, lots of background process, your personal info being synced, etc. But it's not normal getting very hot. Can you check the temperature using an app like Gsam? 
Also, check your battery stats and see if there's any app showing an unusual high percentage. If you tap on the battery graph you can see the signal bar in different colours. Are you having problems with your cell signal? This could also generate some extra heat.

I have been using x play for 2 weeks and i have not experienced any major heating issue to point of concern.
I noticed overheating on 4g connection only. My WiFi if always on approximately.
So i think smartphone bring such a compact device little bit of overheating is OK.

Mine gets warm sometimes from gaming and other tasks, but all phones get warm!

After almost 2 weeks of use, the phone simply refuses to overheat. No matter how many apps I have opened, it keeps its cool 
One exception though. After 10 minutes of having the motorola camera app on, its temperature skyrockets to above 39 C. My explanation is that it continually tries to autofocus, but maybe I am wrong...

Its been only 4 days I bought my Moto X Play. But after using it sometime. It does gets a bit warmer. Please Give me a clue of the happenings. Should I reach Service Centre for this. ??? Please Reply.

It's kind of normal the phone getting a bit warmer the first days. There are a lot of updates, syncs and system processes running in the background. There are other causes that could generate heat, for example a weak cell signal, specially when using mobile data.

Welcome to Android Central! The previous post in this thread was 12/15/16 -- are you referring to other threads where "everybody is saying the same thing"?
It'd help to see some battery stats. Charge up to 100%, then let it drain to 20-30% with normal usage, without charging in between. Then show us:
1. The main Settings>Battery screen.
2. The fullscreen battery graph screen (which shows Awake time and Cell Signal Strength).
3. The Screen category (to see total Screen On time).
4. The Cell Standby category, if present (to see Time Without Signal).http://forums.androidcentral.com/gen...d-central.html
You might have to install a 3rd party battery monitor, like GSam Battery Monitor, to get the Cell Signal Strength graph.

Hey guys.
I don't know if it's the phone, the SIM card, or maybe the network.
For a few weeks I've been experiencing terrible battery drains and overheating in my X Play. I live in Mitcham, London, UK. The 4G coverage was always crap in here. I'm on Vodafone. However, my issue started around the beginning of this year.
When I leave my phone on its stand in my room for the whole day, the battery will go down by 7-8%.
If I put it in my pocket and go to a shop, after coming back after only 40-50 minutes, it heats up and eats 10-12% of power, just lying in the pocket.
Everything's already been checked and tried: cache wipe, network settings reset, even a hard reset has already been done.
When I switch 4G data off, the drain stops.
But in this case, I could as well go back to my ROKR E8... :/
I don't experience overheating in any other cases. Only when the phone is moving with me.
I bought mine just after release, from Moto Maker. Currently the only extra apps installed on the phone are GSam and Viber.
A point of note: with Moto G4 and identical settings, also on the crappy 4G coverage, I'm getting a way better battery life now. I put the blame on January Security Patch here. The only difference is that my Moto G4 already runs Android 7.0. I really do hope that 7.x for the X Play will bring improvements. I don't want to put this phone aside, I like it too much.
These graphs and a chart below show a 40-minute long walk to a shop back and forth.

I haven't found any permanent solution yet, unfortunately.
Tried everything except unlocking and rooting for a custom ROM as the phone is still under warranty. 
I decided to wait until May for that promised 7.x update. I read somewhere (don't remember where) that 7.x contains new JiT compiler, new kernel, and new radio software. Maybe these, combined with updated Doze will do the trick. If not, then I'll be filing a claim with Lenovo.
For now, I switched to my backup phone, Moto G4, which (ironically) has a better battery life (with 3000mAh) than the X Play, and is on 7.0 atm.
So, my temporary solution for the problem is to try to stay calm and use a secondary phone for a while. All this makes me want to go back to Droid RAZR Maxx HD (rooted, reverted to 4.1.2).

I think I found the cause of my problem.
Believe me or not, all this chaos with my phone seems to have been caused by my micro SDXC 64GB memory card. I took it out of the phone and left it alone for a day, it lost only 2% and didn't even get warm. I took it with me for a walk or drive several times, no spikes of high temperature noticed.
Generally, an app called DevCheck allowed me to discover that the CPU was getting locked at maximum fequency on all cores, which led me to a conclusion that Google Play Services' Media Finder was the culprit, everything because of the memory card.
I will test it with a smaller SDHC 32GB card formatted as Fat32 to see if this theory was right.
Edit: SDHC card causes the same thing. Back to testing without any card in.
Edit 2: Now I'm pissed off... I ran into same problems while not having a card in. This makes the whole theory irrelevant. I'm out of ideas now, the only one is to finally switch a brand, after 12 years.

title: Getting "Moto Voice has stopped" error message literally every 5 seconds. All day long.

thread.text:
For the past two or three days, my Moto X Play has been constantly giving me the "Unfortunately, Moto Voice has stopped" error.
I have tried both reporting and clicking OK. For both, I get the error message back up within about 5 seconds.
I have tried to clear the cache and clear the data, but "Moto Voice" doesn't seem to be listed in my Apps. "Moto" is, but no "moto voice". When I go to the App store, it tells me that "Moto Voice" is installed, and when I click on it in the app store, an app opens... but I can't figure out how to open it through the app manager, so as to clear the data or the cache.
Any suggestions?

Me too. :-(
Must be related to a recent app update?
Welcome to Android Central! In the Settings>Apps menu, is there an option to Show or Hide System Apps? If so, make sure it's set to Show System Apps. Then look for Moto Voice.

My Turbo 2 running Marshmallow tells me "Unfortunately, Moto Voice has stopped". It does this continuously; as soon as I hit OK, the message comes right back. As soon as I hit Report, the message comes right back.
I've attempted to boot the phone in Safe Mode, and it still does the same.
Because the message comes right up/back, it is nearly impossible to do anything else with the phone. The message itself cannot be put into the background.
Any ideas on a solution.
I'm not sure of a solution, but I'd just like to say that the same thing is happening on my Moto Z Droid running the new Nougat update.

replies.text:
I just did the Nougat update on my Moto Z Force and started getting the "Moto voice has stopped" pop-up. I knew that I had disabled the Google app (the annoying app that does the searches etc.) because it was constantly turning on and asking if I asked something, which I never did. Anyway, back to the point. I would tap to close the pop-up and very quickly tap at the screen before it popped up again. I navigated to the settings, apps, and to the disabled apps. I re-enabled Google app and the pop-up has stopped for now. We'll see I guess.
So for now, no pop-ups but I have that awful app enabled.
This guy has the solution. Turn on the Google app and the error message stops

You want to do a combo of two answers in here. First do the annoying quick taps between pop ups to re-enable the google app. This will get the annoying error to stop. Then go into your app settings and make sure to set it to "show system apps" NOT hide them. From there you should see Moto Voice listed in your apps. Disable it and then you can go back and disable the google app again.

thread.text: Moto Voice calls the Google app.

Great I did a factory reset and lost data to solve the problem. Which didn't solve the problem but enabling the google app stopped the error message. One way or another you will either choose to enable all google apps or you will be shoved/forced to enable all of their apps. Nudge, shove, shoot.

First I want to say to all the people that say "I'm having the name problem", and not giving a solution S you all!
I was having the same problem on my Verizon Moto Z Force..Android7.0
The "Moto Voice has stopped" message was appearing every split second on my device.
And I found a solution. Hit "OK" and very very quickly hit the settings. During the whole process The "Moto Voice has stopped" will appear again. Hit OK and quickly navigate to the apps. All this time keep on hitting OK on the "Moto Voice has stopped" message.
When you get to apps, hit the 3 circle small icons in the right hand corner, and press the "Reset the apps preferences"
Might take some time because during this process the "Moto Voice has stopped" message will appear every split second.
It worked for me and hopefully it will work for you to

SOLUTION!!!!!!YEAH!!!!!
So, yesterday I went to the Verizon store. I ended up with a rep on the phone. He had me do a hard reset/factory reset and of course I lost a few things.... He said that I would have to get a new phone if it started again. Obviously, not the smartest techs at Verizon.
The phone was fine after that until I turned it off. Then, it started again.... I had disabled apps prior to turning it off. 
So, I turned the Moto app back on and it did not help. 
Then, I turned the Google app back on. It STOPPED the POP-UP! 
This is obviously a glitch after the last update. I now have to keep the stupid Google widget which I don't use on my screen. 
I disabled the Moto app again and and restarted the phone. 
Works fine! Yeah!!! 
I think that the Google app's voice program is connected to the Moto voice. By turning off the Google it messed the Moto app up just like when it removes the voice option on the keyboard of it's turned off.

title: Motorola X Play does not recognize my SD card any longer

thread.text:
I have been using a 128Gb Samsung SD card for a year. Then one day i get an SD card not present error. Ok. Tried reinserting. Nothing. 
i have 2 options: press FORGET and then all my data is lost or keep trying reinserting or some other methods to save the data. 
As the card has been in some way locked and encripted for this phone, it can only be unlocked by the same i suppose. 
Any suggestions?

Welcome to Android Central! Did you format it as Internal Storage? If so, then you're probably out of luck, I'm afraid. Formatting as Internal Storage encrypts the card, so you can't read it on another device like your computer. This is one of the major drawbacks of Adoptable Storage, because SD card reliability is not great, and if the card fails, you lose all of that data.

so ... i have same problem with an x play ... i have been searh many ways to fix this problem ... without any succes ... i have been tried at least 3 ( or maeby 4 - high speed sdcards, adata, samsung, kingston, kingmax ) with same error message ( sdcard damaged ) ... until few days ago ... when i see that " Wipe cache partition " command i and use it. Big surprise ... after while i wipe that cache partition sdcard works fine ... i just will see until then, but now is all ok, just performed a factory hard reset without problems

replies.text:
Well, if you think an iPhone is going to make you happy, just go for it. I'm not sure if it's the best option coming from the X Play though. Most people that bought this phone did it for some specific reasons: excellent big screen, amazing battery life, SD card, dual SIM, Moto features, very affordable price and a good performance (not the fastest out there, but good enough). Most of these are absent in the iPhones and to get a big screen you'll need to pay a lot more money. 
Anyway. The lag you're experiencing is not normal and, as I said, there are some procedures that could help before throwing the phone away.
- Make sure you have the latest system version in settings - about phone - system updates.
- Check your battery stats and your running apps and see if there is something unusual there.
- Clear cached data in settings - storage and restart the phone.
- Unmount the SD card and use the phone for a couple of days without it.
- If nothing works, backup all your data and perform a factory reset.

title: Bluetooth problems...

thread.text:
Hi all,
recently received a set of BT headphones. Loving them with the play, except for when there is other devices in the area and the headphones are paired. Then the BT negotiates with the new devices for their identity causing the audio to stutter on the headphones. it's much worse if the audio is streaming and I open the bluetooth settings.
is there a way to 'bind' the bluetooth to the headphones and not have it scan for devices? I have a feeling this will fix my problem.
(on 6.0.1 by the way)!
Thanks
Stuart

Hi Stuart,
You should try to disable the bluetooth visibility of your MXP to the nearby devices. The option is available in the bluetooth settings option. In this way your MXP will never try to connect to the nearby active bluetooth devices.
However having an active pairing mode ON on all the BT devices sounds bit strange, but in any case the above solution may fix the issue you are facing.
Thanks
Neeraj

Hi there,
Which microSD card do you have?
Where did you buy it? Many cards sold by eBay sellers are counterfeit. The shady sellers claim the cards are much higher capacity than the really are. When the size of the contents on the fake cards exceeds the limit, then errors result. (For example, a 64 GB card that is really only 4 GB.)

I got both my Moto X and the SD card at the same time from the Bell Mobile dealer here in Canada, so doubtful it would be a counterfeit.

Hello,
Here the exactly same problem! after upgraded to Marshmallow Android 6.0 Moto X Play, no solution yet!

Same problem here and I found and followed a fix at: forums.androidcentral DOT com/moto-g-2015/630247-pc-can-t-access-moto-g-files.html#post4937816
This is a known issue with the Marshmallow update on G3 with SD card set as portable storage (users who switched to internal storage seem to have no issues)... Disconnect USB, then Go to Settings, Apps, and Show System Apps, then find External Storage and Media Storage, and clear data and cache on each one and reboot. Give it 5 min after full boot up to rebuild media databases and connect to USB and select MTP, should be good to go. 
Next time I rebooted and connected to PC (Win 10) it was all there! Hope this helps.

replies.text: Yes it eventually damages the card. You better take back up. I haven't got a solution since the phone stopped detecting the SD card which was setup as internal storage. I have lost all my data.

thread.text:
The "complete fix is to format the card as external storage. "Internal" storage is a kind of Band-Aid - if the phone doesn't have enough internal storage (and eventually, all phones run out), adding an SD card as "internal storage" will help - for a short time. (When the card gets full, you can't just put in a larger one - you have to back up all your apps to something other than the phone, back up all their data, clear each app's data, uninstall each app, put in a larger card, then reinstall the app and restore its data. With enough apps, that can take a day or more. And it's a LOT of writing to the new card (writing is what eventually destroys a card.)
It's meant as a "fix" for a small phone (8GB or less internal storage as of 2016) - but it's not a real fix to a problem that can't be solved - a phone has a fixed amount of storage, so every phone will eventually run out, unless you don't add any apps or data. (SunOS does it the right way - storage is storage, regardless of where it is - or even WHAT it is - but formatting an SD card as internal storage is a kind-of/sort-of "fix" that doesn't really fix a problem that has nothing to do with the amount of storage in the phone.)

title: Woke up to the SD-Card-Not-Readable-Problem

thread.text:
I'm running a non-rooted, Moto X Play with 6.0.1 Android with 32GB class 10 SanDisk SD card formatted as internal. 
It worked perfectly for months after purchase. A few days ago I woke up to the SD problem, where the Phone doesn't recognize the SD Card. I haven't cliked the "forget" button since it might kill all the info I have on the SD. 
After restarting the phone it works OK for several hours. It might randomly get the popup the error. I can constantly replicate it by connecting the phone to the wall-charger, the one that came with the phone. I'm restarting the phone every morning for it to work ok during the day. But on the last 2 days it popped the error randomly during the day. 
I found lots of posts with the description of the error. But not a single one with a definite solution to this.
A couple of questions: 
1. Is there a definite solution for it?. What is it?. 
2. Is the SD card being damaged by the phone?. Or is it just a software issue?.
3. Will getting a new SD card solve the issue?. 
4. If I format the next SD card as external... will I be able to runn apps (games) from there without performance issues?. 
5. Might a factory reset of the phone do the trick?. 
Thank you,

SanDisk, huh? You paid a little more - but you get so much more.
Go to SanDisk microSD Tech Support. (Upper right corner for live chat.) They'll walk you through it and, if the card is defective, tell you how to return it for a new one. They stand behind their products. (And no, I've never worked for them, I just like a good company.)

In another topic, you post about the "internal formatting" to be a band aid... should I format the faulty "internal" SD as an external storage?. If so, can I have apps in there and run them normally?. 
I don't mind losing the info in the SD Card, since all photos backup in dropbox, and I can reinstall all the apps since they all have could saving and I wont lose progress in the games. 
If so, how do I do it?... just "forget" the sd card, and then formatting again? 
Thanks.
@rukbat Also, it seems the SanDisk Tech is for US residents. I'm from Chile, so It seems I cannot access that feature.

I think I solved it. Did two things: 
1. I found a corrupted video in the SD card. I deleted it. How did I know it was corrupted. I ordered my Dropbox app to backup all photos. It kept crashing at the same video popping up the non-read SD card error. I searched for that video and deleted it. 
2. I cleaned the golden things from the SD card with a Q-tip and alcohol, let it air dry for a few minutes then back in.
So far I wasn't able to replicate the error. So this might be a solution.

title: Moto x play. SD card nightmare

thread.text:
Hi all first post. Hate my moto x play with a passion .
Started out fine until the storage capacity was reached on the phone. Got an SD card and ran it as external storage for a little while. But it started crashing the phone. So I formatted the card for internal storage. That was my major mistake. Now for months my phone stops reading the SD card numerous times a day. And when it does this, if the phone is left untouched it reboots constantly every 6 minutes and 30 seconds exactly . 
Problem is I can't do anything with this card because the memory is larger than my phone can handle, and it's not readable by a PC now. So when it crashes I can only re insert it into the phone until it decides to recognize it again. Or format the card. 
I am on my third new card using different brands. I have also tried numerous cards around the house with the same results.
This is not an SD card issue. It is definitely the phone. I have deleted all apps. At this point I only have pics and music on my phone, all apps when loaded have to be transfered back to internal memory, or the phone crashes.
So my provider wants me to do a full reboot and then they want to track it for a week to see if they can see a problem. I already know where this is going, but I'm over a barrel.
If I do a full backup, then wipe the phone. On restart, will it recognize the SD card or will it demand it be formatted again. If it needs to be formatted again, I'll loose everything, yet again .

Welcome to Android Central! Unfortunately, this is one of the major drawbacks of Adoptable Storage. Although it sounds good in theory, in practice it can be glitchy, sometimes due to the generally lower reliability of SD memory, and sometimes due to glitchy implementation of this Android feature by the phone manufacturer.
I don't have a good direct solution for you, but let me ask you this -- what is pushing your phone's storage to the limit? Is it the quantity/size of installed apps, or is it saved media (photos, videos, music)? If it's media, then I would strongly recommend making use of cloud solutions like Google Photos and Google Play Music. Keeping media in the cloud can significantly free up your storage, and will still allow you to temporarily download certain files for offline use. If it's apps, then ask yourself how many of your installed apps you actually use on a regular basis. Uninstall the ones that you never or rarely use.
If you haven't already tried it, wipe the system cache partition, which won't erase any personal data: https://motorola-global-en-aus.custh...p/30,6720,9392

title: Why is my hotspot dropping?

thread.text:
Ok guys, I serched all the internet for a solution and couldn`t find...
I found a couple of topics about hotspot problems here and there but none of them were exactly my problem or would fix my problem...
I have a Moto X Play, and when I create an wi-fi hotspot to use the internet on my laptop, every few seconds, sometimes minutes, the hotspot signal is gone, and than it comes back by itself... after a while it doesn`t come back at all and I have to reset my phone,
When I enter my hotspot configs there's no such thing as "timeout option", as there are in other Androids,
I saw a guy saying that he fixed his problem by removing the screen block pattern and changing the sleep time to 15s. For me it doesn`t work..
What it looks like is that when my 4g signal is a bit low, the hotspot turns off and on again, maybe to try to get a better signal, but I don`t know.
Somewhere I found people saying that it was some config about battery-saving. I tried to change some of those configs on my battery options, as to change Android System for example from 'saving battery' to 'not save battery' but it also didn`t work..
If anyone has a tip or know how to fix it please let me know, Im desperate already. My laptop has few USB sockets and it`d be good if I didn't have to use 1 for USB-tethering.
Thanks in advance,

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!
Did you ever figure out the issue? Are you able to change the hotspot to 5GHZ?

title: TWRP Error Code 7 trying to flash rom

thread.text:
Hi Folks,
While trying different roms on my Moto X Play I managed to do something that has caused TWRP to no longer flash roms, it spits out this code "Error Code 7" when it fails. Which from what I can tell means that my phone is reporting to be a different phone to the roms I am trying to install, 
The only way I can now install a rom is through ADB. I am currently using XT1562_LUX_RETEU_6.0.1_MPD24.107-52. I have not found a lot on the net but have tried any suggestions i could find including trying to roll back to a stock rom fromt the motorola website (LUX_RETLA_DS_LPD23.118-6.1_cid12_lux_retla_ds) but that didn't fix it. Don't think it entirely rolls back to the previous version
I also can't seem to root my current stock rom but am sure I was able to before I had this problem. Flashing super SU just hangs the rom and I have ot install the entire rom through ADB again.
Any help to sort out this very frustrating problem would be most appreciated.
n

title: Why does naming convention change for photos on Moto X Play?

thread.text:
when i take photos on my Moto X Play, they upload to my google photos, which in turn syncs to my Linux desktop.... I just tried to locate the most recent photo I took today, but whichever order i listed them, it kept appearing near the middle of the lit in my file explorer (Caja)
I notice that although the photos are taken with the same camera, they seem to have several different naming conventions, namely;
IMG_yyymmdd_nnnnnn (underscores, and nnnn does not reflect the time - sometimes 6 random numerics, sometimes 9)
IMG-yyymmnn-WAnnnn (dashes then WA followed by sequential 4 digit no. 0001, 0002 etc)
or just nnnnnnnnnnnnn.jpg (13 random numerics) 
why should one photo have a different naming convention to the next one etc?!?! very confused :-/
also noticed that although the file sizes are not that big in general terms (typically between about 1.3 and 3Mb), the actual image size in pixels seems very high (eg 2448 x 3264 px)... it is my understanding that free storage on google photos is <2048 x 2048px... my camera is set to upload to google photos at the 'reduced' size rather than full original size
thanks in advance
Mod note. Thread moved to the Moto X Play forum for more visibility.
gentle *bump*

Thanks for registering and welcome to the forums. Do you get the same kind of filenames if you browse using the stock file manager? Try in settings - storage & USB - internal storage - images - camera - three dots top right - list view.
I checked on my X Play and all the pictures are name as IMG_yyyyddmm_time_HDR(sometimes)
The time is 9 digits for the original photo or 6 if they were cropped from the gallery app.

think i have worked it out... 
IMG_yyyymmdd_nnnnnnnnn.jpg - stock camera
IMG-yyyymmdd-WAnnnn.jpeg - Whatsapp
FB_IMG_nnnnnnnnnnnnn.jpg - Facebook
xxxxxxxxxxxxx.jpg - Facebook Messenger
IMG_yyyymmdd_nnnnnn.jpg - Instagram
etc......
it is a pain because i cant list by 'modified date' because this shows the date of the last time a change was saved to the image - NOT the date it was taken, which would make perfect sense... i therefore have to rely on the file name to locate images - which is equally difficult with a wild gamut of prefixes and suffixes..
each of the apps appears to use the stock camera to take pictures, so why cant they all agree to use the camera's naming convention - but by all means stick a WA, or FB or IG etc AFTER the filename so it can still be sorted in the correct order?!?!?!!?

title: Battery Drainage Issue on Moto X Play

thread.text:
Hi All,
I just got a new Moto X Play, I was confused between Moto G4 plus and Moto X Play, but I chose it over G4 plus because of the higher battery capacity. But it seems the battery backup is not good. I was earlier using Moto G3 and X play backup looks even worse than G3. Any suggestion to get a better battery backup?? Also, what is the average backup duration considering 1 hr of calling, 3 hrs of facebook/internet surfing, 1-2 hes of listening music (on headphones) and absolutely no gaming.
Thanks in advance for the suggestions.

Welcome to the forums. Battery life depends greatly on your personal usage. There are many factors to be considered, WiFi vs Mobile data, cell signal, location settings, Bluetooth, screen brightness, sync settings, widgets ... Also, battery life is always worse the first days, until the system settles down and you complete a few full charges. 
Use your phone normally and take screenshots of your battery stats when there's about 30℅ of charge left. Post them here and we'll take a look. Just be aware that apps like Facebook will use a lot of juice.

replies.text:
Hi Javier P,
As suggested I have uploaded the screen shot of the battery usage.
Thanks
Regards
Neeraj

thread.text: I think your biggest drain comes from a bad cell signal. The signal bar is mostly orange and even nonexistent sometimes. Do you have signal problems in your area or maybe using the phone inside a big building?

I haven't experienced this bug but it seems related to the Location services. This process worked for several people having the same issue. 
- Go to settings - location - three dots top right - scanning - uncheck WiFi and Bluetooth. 
- Settings - backup & reset - network settings reset - reset settings. 
- Reboot your phone for the changes to apply. You need to check if the problem persists after a full charge. 
- If it doesn't work try wiping the cache partition on recovery. https://plus.google.com/116973596552...ts/ZqLAhvUEFkS
Tell us how it goes and if it works give credit to the Brazilian guys in this Google+ community

By the way, did you manage to stop the battery drain?

title: MOTO X-PLAY: SD cards slow? SD cards shredded? Ghostdata on SD cards?

thread.text:
THIS IS A SOMEWHAT LONGISH POST .... YOU COULD JUMP TO THE END AND MAYBE YOU DON'T NEED TO CONSIDER EVERYTHING, BUT I RATHER POST ALL THE DETAILS INSTEAD OF PROVIDING THEM PIECEMEAL DURING DISCUSSION. 
I am at my wits end. Looking for help to understand and fix the issues with my Moto X-Play, SD Cards, and Marshmallow, maybe even Windows adds to the complexity here. This is the story - the earlier parts may not be 100% accurate:
December: Bought Moto X-Play 16GB (my carrier doesn't offer a 32 or 64 GB model, I wished they did) and shortly thereafter in a 128 GB Samsung EVO+ . This is a class 10 card, as recommended by Motorola. I pop it into the device and get the message: This card is slow blablabla .... I am thinking WTF???!!!! .... this is a class 10 card, what more do you want? Further research indicates that with a w/r speed of 80/20, this card might not be top of the line class 10. I chose to use it nevertheless and decide to just use it for certain non-critical apps and for the storage of photos and stuff. I install ES File Explorer. I am seeing the SD card, I am able to install some apps there and put some media files on it.
End of January: I am updating to Marshmallow and leaving the country for 3.5 months (I am mentioning this because you might wonder why it took me so long to deal with this ....).
At some point, I am running out of space for photos. I notice that I can't access the SD card. It shows in Settings/Storage & USB, but I can't drill down. I can also see it in ES File Explorer, but again, can't access the sd card's file structure. I am trying different File Explorers (Solid Explorer), to no avail. I end up manually deleting the photos after back-up, but this issue keeps occurring:
1: I can't move the photos from the internal storage to the SD card, despite the SD card showing in Storage &USB
2. I can't set the photo application to saving the photos directly to the SD card
May: Upon my return, I am talking to Motorola about this. During the chat they get me to adopt the SD card as internal storage. At first, nothing changes: I am not seeing the SD card capacity added to internal storage. I think it took restarting the device for the full capacity (16 + 128 GB) to show both in Settings/Storage and Solid Explorer (I dumped ES, terrible with all the ads).
June: However, I do notice that the device is somewhat sluggish now. I am traveling quite a bit and the phone is my main means of connectivity, I want to improve the situation and decide to buy a better SD card (Sandisk Extreme + 64 GB, [95/90]).
a) I unmount the 128 GB Samsung SD card.
b) I install the 64 GB Sandisk as internal memory, which seems to work
c) I try reformatting the 128 GB SD card for further usage on my Windows 7 desk top: the drive is visible in Windows Explorer only intermittently. It cannot be accessed in any way ("Insert disk into drive"). I try the same thing with my Windows 10 laptop (upgraded from Windows 8): the drive is not visible at all. I am trying two different adapters. Just for the sake of curiosity, I try the same thing with the 64 GB card: same result – invisible to Windows. An old 16 GB card works fine with the adapters and is visible and accessible in Windows Explorer.
That same night, a part of the tray that holds the SD and SIM cards pops off. I bring my device to the carrier for repair. I tell them about the SD card issues. 
July 8: My carrier admits to having lost my phone. They give me a new one (and want to charge me $150 for a new phone .... WTF?????!!!!! The device is under manufacturer's warranty AND I have an extended warranty plan AND you lost it!)
I am setting the new phone up, with the 64 GB card in it. The device lets me know that the card is slow. WTF??????!!!! So, I am talking to Motorola wanting to know why. 
a) I can't format neither the 128 nor the 64 GB card. Did Moto X-play render them useless? I am told I should be able to reformat them. They have no explanation why they do not appear in Windows Explorer "It depends on the pc". (I tried two already). 
b) my device now thinks that a highspeed class 10 UHS-1 rated card is still too slow. I didn't get that message the first time I installed it (into the old device). If that is really true, then what type of card should I be using? I don’t get an answer to that.
We reset the device twice: 
1.	Without card in it through Settings/Backup & reset/Factory data reset. In Settings/Storage & USB, the cards shows as unsupported.
2.	With card through Recovery Option after powering the device off. The card still shows as unsupported.
Motorola sends me back to the carrier to have them send the device in for repairs. (I am thinking I might be caught in a novel of Kafka).
The guy at the carrier’s kiosk goes into Settings/Storage & USB card. Despite the ‘unsupported’ status, he chooses the sd card and is able to format it as internal storage. All looks good. (I didn’t look at the values of storage used at the time). 
I go back home and decide to start all fresh, instead of restoring the back-up of my old device from Google drive. After having installed most of the apps that I used to have my previous device, the new one is showing 26.80GB used. WTF????!!!!! These are less apps than I had before on 16 GB internal storage and NO APPLICATION DATA, NO MEDIA FiLES. 
I check under Settings/Storage & USB:
Device Storage: 26.80 GB
Android OS: 5.11 GB (this looks normal)
Internal storage: 3.01 GB used of 10.89 (this looks normal)
Apps: 2.59 GB
Cached data: 22.63 MB
SandDisk SD card: 18.67 used of 58.53 (that doesn’t look normal)
so here is what the device sees there: 
Apps: 1.21 GB
Images: 6.60 MB
Videos: 4.00 KB
Audio: 20.00 KB
Other: 3.43 MB
Cached Data: 43.03 MB
this means there is de facto less than 1.5 GB in data on that SD card, but the device sees 17 GB more. I am not even talking about the 5.5 GB that seem to be missing from the card's label value of 64 GB. 
So … what to do? 
a)	About the 64 GB SD card - How can I get rid of the ghostdata?
b)	Should I configure as internal storage and if not, how can I get photos to directly save to portable SD card?
c)	About the 128 GB SD card? Return to retailer? It’s still under warranty.
d)	Get a new SD card with even better specs?
All leads appreciated.

So where are you at now with your situation? My problems are minor in comparison to yours, but nonetheless I am experiencing some strangeness... I have a few apps that keep uninstalling after I reboot my Moto X pure device!!

title: Why can't I only see some of my photos to download?

thread.text:
I have 327 photos and a bunch of videos in the Camera Roll of my Moto X Play. When I plug it into my laptop to transfer photos, it only pics up 96 photos and some of the videos. The other photos don't seem to exist for download?
To troubleshoot I have:
Restarted the phone and reconnected it to the laptop to see if that changed anything (it didn't)
Checked if I could email the photos or move them to another file (all was possible).
Searched for the photos in the folders by their name but only the first 96 show up.
THERE IS NO SD CARD IN MY PHONE SO IT IS NOT A CASE OF IT READING FROM DIFFERENT MEMORY. 
None of this seemed to work and I am not sure how to fix it.
Any advice guys? Thanks in advance!

Hi, so when you say you have 327 photos - are these all in your film roll? or are they made up of camera images and downloaded files from the internet / Whatsapp etc. If it's the latter, they won't all be stored in the same place on the internal storage. Camera images are stored in DCIM, downloaded images are saved in the download folder, instagram filtered images are stored in the instagram folder.....

title: Motox Play Active Display. It's dreadful, am I doing something wrong?

thread.text:
Hello,
I didn't realise my moto x play did not have an LED. However I was assured in an online chat that Active Display was awesome. Am I doing something wrong?
1. Nothing is displayed on my screen unless I pick it up, then it shows me the clock and any messages
2. If I wait half a second it disappears and nothing will bring it back unless I put it down for about 10 seconds. Wiggling it did nothing other than bring up my camera
3. I was playing a game and never noticed a notification came in. Back in rest mode absolutely nothing was displayed so the only time I realised I had a message was when I switched on the phone. It seems active display only wants to be active if you aren't using your phone when a message comes in.
4. I saw in a video you can 'just look at the phone' and the clock/notifications appear. Nothing happened for me.
5. I heard in a video it glows now and again. Never happened to me, it only does it once when I pick up the phone.
Am I doing something wrong? and how exactly is this better than a LED - with an LED notification I know something is there because I get a flashing light, and it's there whether I'm using my phone or not, and is always there until I read the messages. If I could even touch the screen to bring up the active display it might be more useful, but it doesn't even do that.
tbh, if this is the best it gets, I'm sending the phone back, I've only had it 1 day and I hate not knowing I have notifications as this seems not fit for the job.
Are you able to see any notifications if you wave your hand over the device?

Moto active display on Moto X Play uses accelerometer, not proximity sensor. So it glows when you just move or shake device slightly or noticifation is available. And yes, any notification shows only in stand by. Also, if you set a specific times to not turn on display at all, for eg. at night, it will not glow when notification available.
Posted via the Android Central App
No, and that's my point. Completely crap compared to a simple LED.

It depends. For me it is much better than any blinking LED. So maybe it is a crap for you but also maybe very useful "crap" for others

title: Why can't I see files of my SD card on my Laptop?

thread.text: I just upgraded my Moto x play to marshmallow and after that when i am connecting my mobile to my laptop my sd card files are not showing there but internal storage files are showing there.

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!
You might have to actually plug your SD Card in to your computer and get the files that way. I would then put the card back in your phone and format it again.

thread.text:
Same problem here and I found and followed a fix at: forums.androidcentral DOT com/moto-g-2015/630247-pc-can-t-access-moto-g-files.html#post4937816
This is a known issue with the Marshmallow update on G3 with SD card set as portable storage (users who switched to internal storage seem to have no issues)... Disconnect USB, then Go to Settings, Apps, and Show System Apps, then find External Storage and Media Storage, and clear data and cache on each one and reboot. Give it 5 min after full boot up to rebuild media databases and connect to USB and select MTP, should be good to go. 
Next time I rebooted and connected to PC (Win 10) it was all there! Hope this helps.

Go to developer settings and switch on usb debugging mode...
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Thanks, this solved my issue. Can write to either SD portable or phone, cool.
Posted via the Android Central App

thread.text:
I tried various options that are shown here with no luck. But after playing around this worked for me.
Under "Developer Options"
1. Turn "Legacy DHCP Client" on.
2 Set USB configuration to MTP protocol.(Default)
3 Turn USB debugging on.

Thanks all
Girinath's posting was a way I, and a blessing
I have followed his instructions, but as it did not work, I tried other options and got it to work by using media instead of MTP protocol.(Default). Voila!

Change the values in settings - display - sleep and in settings - security - automatically lock. 
Clear cache in settings - storage & usb - internal storage - cached data and then restart the phone.

If nothing works maybe you should consider a factory reset as a last resort. There's a possibility that you have a faulty device that needs to be replaced. Tell us how it goes.
Another idea. Do you you use a case? If so, take it out and see if it makes a difference.

title: 2 sudden issues: PC and phone don't recognize one another and the phone will not lock

thread.text:
1 day old Moto X Play, and neither of these issues were present yesterday. It would lock after pressing power button or sleeping naturally and PIN was required to wake up, and PC recognized it fine and used it to transfer my stuff to it on the first day.
This is my first Android. I installed Nova Launcher, but didn't do much other than movie icons around. Smart Lock is off, PIN security is activated, phone is set to lock on hitting power button or if phone is asleep for five seconds. Nonetheless, it just turns the screen off no matter what, it doesn't lock, so the power button just wakes it back up to the home screen.
As for the PC issue, it charges when plugged into my PC, so the connection is made, but they no longer recognize one another. I believe it is upgraded fully - I haven't been rolling it back or forbidding updates or anything.
What gives? Tks.

Welcome to the forums! About the USB connection. Once you plug your phone into the PC swipe down from the status bar, tap on the USB entry and select MTP. 
Not sure about the lock screen. You could try safe mode and see if the problem persists. This will tell you if there's a conflict with a third party app that you downloaded. 
Tell us how it goes.

Thanks for answering so quickly.
Noob question I'm afraid - the 'Status Bar' is the notification bar at the top of the screen with my signal strengths etc? If I swipe down from there there's nothing to tap or interact with, just a message that there are no new notifications. I'm probably in the wrong spot.
Just checked now - both problems persist in Safe Mode!

Sorry, just had to pull up an account to keep replying I think, so I am thread author fyi.
Tks again - not sure what could be causing this!

Thanks for registering! Did you install a new system update? Which android version is your phone running? You can find this information in settings - about phone. 
Let's try something different for the lock screen. Long press on a blank spot in your screen, select widgets, first in the list will be Nova actions. Long press on it, drag it to your home screen and select 'screen lock'. This will create a shortcut on your home screen. Tap on it and see how it works. 
About the USB. Do you mean that you don't get a notification after you plug the phone into the PC? That's weird. Take a look at this article. 
Inside Marshmallow: USB connection options http://www.androidcentral.com/inside...ection-options
If nothing works you could try clearing cache in settings - storage & usb - cached data and then restart your phone. You could also wipe the cache partition via recovery.
Also, I'll get in touch with the moderators and see if they can move this thread to the X Play forum where you could get more feedback from other owners.

I'm running 6.0 
Made the Screen Lock icon, but it did the same, just turning off the screen essentially. Power button still just wakes it up with no PIN required.
About the USB, neither the PC or phone react, other than the phone's battery indicator getting the lightning bolt indicating charging. I'm not sure if I'm looking in the wrong spot, but there's nothing in the status/notification bar for me to tap on as it describes in the page you linked.
I did the cache clear, and restart - both issues still present. What a pickle!
Thanks for the thread move - do you suppose it's something particular to the Moto, or Marshmallow/Nova? Not Nova I suppose since the Safe Mode didn't change it.

Very strange. The screen lock widget should override any smart lock setting, so we need to look in a different place. Try this. Go to settings - security - screen lock. Do you get a screen to enter your pin? If so, enter it and change it to pattern. See what happens. 
Can you use a different USB lead to connect to your computer? Also, try the cache partition wipe.
I think this issue is particular to your phone. Never read before about this screen lock problem (Lollipop or Marshmallow).

Yep I was required each time I visited the security menu to enter my PIN. I changed to pattern, now I have to enter that to go into the security menu, but the phone still won't lock.
I've tried on two different PCs, three total USB cables. Is the 'cache partition wipe' different than the "clear cached data" that I did?

Yeah, they are different processes. These Motorola instructions should work. https://motorola-global-portal.custh...41/kw/recovery
I'm not sure what else to suggest short of a factory reset. It's a brand new phone and shouldn't present these problems. There's a chance that you've got a faulty device. Try one more thing. Go to settings - apps - three dots top right - reset app preferences, then restart. 
Just in case I would backup everything you don't want to lose and get prepared for a factory reset.
Forgot to mention. On the X Play the cache wipe usually takes a few seconds.

No change - even tried Safe Mode again because I figure it must have been an app (only got six that were very popular) or Nova, but not luck. I guess we might be down to factory reset... thanks for your help anyway! Sorry to pretty much waste your time! If it happens again or something, I'll update this since who knows, that would be more mystery!
Thanks again!
No problem! Please, report back, your feedback will be very helpful for other people with a similar issue. Good luck.

I was thinking about what else could interfere with the lock screen and I had a couple more ideas. Long shots but still worth trying before a factory reset 
In your app drawer open the Moto app, tap on the three stars top right, select Moto Display and switch it off. 
Go to settings - security - device administrators and see what apps are checked in there.

One day my new phone will work well... right?

title: Resetting the always option for videos?

thread.text: Clear app caches can be done for individual apps by going to Settings>Apps, tapping on an app, then tapping the Clear Cache button there. (In Marshmallow on some devices, you may have to tap the Storage heading for the app, then Clear Cache.) title: Apps Resetting after use - Android 6 Moto X Play

thread.text: Got my Play a few months back, and I've had this problem since I got it. It was happening on Android 6, and still happens on 6.0.1. Some of my apps (Geometry Dash for example) keep getting reset after I close them or after a while (like 30 mins - 1 hr). It erases all my game data. I also cannot do a factory reset, when I try my phone crashes and I have to reboot. Any help is appreciated!

Welcome to Android Central! When you say it erases your game data, do you mean that the current game you were playing isn't paused? Or do these games actually have a save game function, but the saved games are being erased?
My guess is that the games are being closed out of RAM by the system when it needs to free up RAM for another app or process. This is how Android manages RAM. Apps that you use and then close don't necessarily remain cached in the background forever--the system dynamically manages what apps remain in RAM and which ones should close to allow another app to open.
You should also make sure that you're not running a "RAM booster" app, because these usually work by automatically closing apps out of RAM, even if that additional RAM isn't needed by the system. This can be detrimental to the system's performance.

Install google play and make a gamer ID. Connect to your mail ID while playing a gaming.
Google play app saves the game data while playing in online..

title: Why won't some aps move to Adopted SD on Marshmallow?

thread.text:
I've done the formatting for my Moto X Play to adopt the SD card. So I can now move some aps. However, I thought this adoption process made the Sd a fullly integrated memory source you could move everything to? But the list of aps I can move across seems even more limited than it did on older versions of Android.
Bough a 16GB phone thinking this would be ok after only just having not enough on the 8GB Moto G. But if I'm even more limited in what can go on Sd even after the odd 'adoption' process I may be pretty stuck again.
Android really doesn't like people having access to extra capacity does it?

Welcome to Android Central! Making your SD card into adoptable storage incorporates that card into the phone's Internal Storage. So it no longer is recognized as a separate location. You should see your total Internal Storage increase after making the card adoptable, but be aware that if the card fails, it can cause various problems. Read more here: Inside Marshmallow: Adoptable storage | Android Central

Yes, not all apps can be moved. Only if they support or supported app2sd before. So it is still for developers to decide, make movable apps or not. The main difference is that app2sd apps now are moved fully, not partially as in older OS versions.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text: Glad it helped!

thread.text:
Hello,
as many others, I also have the Wi-Fi drain problem with my X Play.
I've read some other threads in this forum (even in other forums) and it seems like the issue still hasn't been resolved.
I tried almost everything:
Factory reset, changing location settings, letting the battery recharge a few times etc but the Wi-Fi drain is still there.
I'm honestly considering to root it back to Lollipop if there's no other way. Does anyone have an idea?
By the way, thank you for taking your time to help out, Javier. I've seen you in multiple threads about the issue.

replies.text:
Hello nyquistfrequency, welcome to the forums! Yeah, unfortunately the WiFi drain persists for some people no matter what they do. It's a funny bug. Before going back to Lollipop you could try a couple more things. 
Have you received the January security patch? It fixed the problem for some people. 
Doing the whole procedure in a very specific order seems to make a big difference. First uncheck WiFi and Bluetooth in the location settings, then reset network settings, power the phone off and let it charge until full. Before a normal restart go into recovery and wipe the cache partition. 
Another thing. For some people even with WiFi high on the battery stats doesn't necessarily mean that there's a drain. It's just a bug giving a bad reading and battery life isn't affected.

title: Why can't my Moto X Play with Android Marshmallow detect the SD card?

thread.text:
When my phone( Motorola X Play) became available for the marshmallow update I was excited and immediately upgraded it. I then stored all the files from SD card to my laptop and proceeded to format the SD card to be adopted. After the formatting of the SD card, it's been fine until my phone is saying 'insert SD card' or something. title: Marshmallow Doze not wok on my Moto X Play, how can I get it working?

thread.text:
Recently bought a Moto X Play - updated it to Marshmallow.
When I go to Battery Optimisation and select All Apps, it tells me all apps are being optimised however if I press back or home, then go back into battery optimisation, it tells me nothing is being optimised and I have to optimise all apps again

App optimisation and doze is diffrent. App optimisation will detect an app that you rarely use and puts them to sleep for good until you use it again.
While doze puts your phone on sleep when no movement is detected. They are diffrent.

title: Why my computer can read my card after upgrading to mm6? (using mtp)

thread.text:
I upgraded my Moto X Play to MM and when I saw the option about the SD just went to my computer before picking any of them to try to make a backup. The weird thing is that it only shows "ss-ram-dumps" folder and none of the other ones there.
If I search with my phone using Astro everything is there so I'm sure it's not deleted, but if I connect my phone by usb I can only see that folder and if I try to connect the card using a card reader it says that the card can't be read because of the filesystem used.
Any help will really be apreciated, I just want to be able to save all my photos and music.

Turn the phone off. Take the card out. Plug the card into the computer. (If the computer doesn't have an SD slot - the card should have come with an adapter to a full-size SD slot - you'll need a USB card reader (I use the Anker 8 in one - it takes both full and micro size cards (and can read 2 at once) and is only $8. Then you should be able to copy files from the card to the computer.

Same problem here and I found and followed a fix at: forums.androidcentral DOT com/moto-g-2015/630247-pc-can-t-access-moto-g-files.html#post4937816
This is a known issue with the Marshmallow update on G3 with SD card set as portable storage (users who switched to internal storage seem to have no issues)... Disconnect USB, then Go to Settings, Apps, and Show System Apps, then find External Storage and Media Storage, and clear data and cache on each one and reboot. Give it 5 min after full boot up to rebuild media databases and connect to USB and select MTP, should be good to go. 
Next time I rebooted and connected to PC (Win 10) it was all there! Hope this helps.

title: USB Audio Moto X Play

thread.text:
So I really need some help with this, I picked up a USB OTG cable but it hasn't changed anything. My car doesn't support bluetooth, and I can't change songs from my car controls using AUX (plus the sound quality is not as good) I really need to figure this out, I also have a Samsung soundbar I'd like to connect my phone to. Please help.
Posted via the Android Central App

If you car supports audio through USB (which, in reality, it probably only supports reading MP3 files off your phone, not really transmitting audio from it or controlling it in any way other than requesting a different file) why would you get an OTG cable? Those are to connect generic-profile devices TO your phone (like mice, keyboard, and external storage). 
Connecting the normal USB cable to your car system should work (same thing with the soundbar IF it supports USB file reading).

It just comes up and says USB error on the car, a d No USB on the soundbar. And I read somewhere I needed an OTG cable for it. I do have other uses for the cable anyway so not a waste of money.
Posted via the Android Central App

Also it does support controlling it as I've had other USB audio devises hooked up and been able to switch track via the buttons on the back of the steering wheel. It also supports more than just MP3
Posted via the Android Central App

Yup, but it doesn't 'control' the device (if you look at your phone while it's plugged in, there's really no music playing there), it's just reading the files off the phone as a storage drive and playing them through the car's music player, VS Bluetooth controls that audio is being routed from your phone to your car's speakers and the music playback is actually being handled by the phone. This works for iPhones because most cars have the iProtocols (not the actual name, BTW) licensed for it so it works differently. 
For your phone to work, though, it might need to be put into either USB Storage Mode (IIRC, this mode was removed from Android a long time ago) or Media Transfer Protocol Mode (MTP).

I can't seem to find any apps to enable Mass Storage mode and the MTP doesn't work either. I wonder why they took out the Mass Storage option and didn't design the OS and devise in such away that audio could be played through usb. I guess if I want to go for sound quality now I'll have to get a DAC. Thanks anyway.
Posted via the Android Central App

Try this first on a computer. When you connect your phone through USB there should be a legend on the notification bar saying that the phone is either just charging or if it's ready for file transfer (THIS is the mode you want!). Now, depending on your car system, if it doesn't support MTP and it needs generic USB Storage profiles, you won't be able to use your phone with that car system, unfortunately. Some people have to Enable USB Debugging in their phones (it should be in your settings, it's not an app, and you may have to enable Developer Mode on your phone to see that menu) in order to get their computers to recognize them. You might want to try that and see if it helps with the car.
The 'official' version is that Generic Mass Storage was removed from the OS for security reasons (and a valid point, to a certain extent). As to why the Audio through USB driver wasn't included, you'd need to ask the car system manufacturer... the ability to do it IS in your phone, it's the accessories that don't implement the protocol.
This from a carrier's page...might help change the USB connection mode. How to change the USB connection options on my Motorola Moto X Play
Ah I see. Nice to know it's the equipment and not the phone. I have USB debugging on but no difference unfortunately.
Does a computer see your phone's files without issues? Or does it install specific drivers to do so?

Without issues.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: In call volume

thread.text:
I have a problem when making a call in that I cannot hear the other person, unless it's on loud speaker. I thought that with Android phones you could adjust call volume during a call, but when I press the volume buttons during a call, the screen displays the ring volume icon with no mention of in call volume. Could there be a fault with the phone or is there something I could try?
Thanks for any replies.

That's strange. I just double checked in my X Play and I can adjust the call volume while on a call. I get the volume slider and the phone icon. Are you using a third party dialer? Does the problem persist after a reboot?

Thanks for the reply. I'm using the standard software. I've just done a factory reset and the problem is still there. When I press the volume button during a call I just get the ring volume icon next to the slider. It's weird!
Edit: When I switch to loudspeaker and then press the volume button the call icon then does appear next to the slider.

Yeah, that's weird! Three possibilities I can think of. 
- Defective unit. Check with Motorola or your carrier. 
- A conflict with a third party app that you downloaded. Boot in safe mode and see if the problem persists. 
- Some conflict in your settings. Go to settings - apps - three dots top right - reset app preferences and reboot. 
The factory reset should have fixed the last two possibilities but there's a chance that those options were restored from your account backup.
I noticed your edit after I posted my reply. That's even weirder! It's your phone retail or from a network provider? Do you have any specific carrier settings?

Sorry my last reply did not post properly.I have since spoken to Motorola who talked me through the safe mode, but it did not work. As it seems so simple, I feel like I'm missing something obvious, but the retailer (john lewis) has agreed to replace it anyway.
Good luck then. Tell us how it goes.

replies.text: Update on this: I had a new phone delivered which works perfectly. It seemed a very odd fault and I'm now nervous to play around with the in-call volume on the new one in case it stops working!

thread.text:

I personally find in call volume to be low, even when maxed out.
Speaker volume is plenty adequate though.

title: GPU Performance on the Moto X Play (Snapdragon 615)

thread.text:
So, I just read Anandtech's review of the new Moto G. What interested me the most was GPU performance graphs. 
Much fuss has been made about the Snapdragon 615 and its GPU performance. Many have written off buying the Moto X Play for this very reason.
However, these graphs from Anandtech reveal that in every 3D benchmark performed on-screen the Huawei P8 Lite (SD 615, Adreno 405, 1080p) slightly outperforms the LG G4 (SD 808, Adreno 418, 1440p). It even rivals the Nexus 6 (SD 805, Adreno 420, 1440p) in some cases! It appears that the lower display resolution makes up for the less powerful GPU. Therefore, there isn't really any need to worry about GPU performance. It won't beat phones with 1080p displays that have more powerful GPUs but can provide a gaming experience on par with current flagships such as LG G4, Nexus 6 and one has to assume the Moto X Style too!

Very good observation. Although it is a bit disappointing that both the 615 / 1080p and 808 / 1440p combos are outperformed by last year's and 2013's popular 801 / 1080p combo. Ever since the Nexus 5 (2013), performance on Android has basically hit a wall because any performance gains have been negated by QHD displays.
I would really like to see Anandtech compare the displays of the Play and Style. QHD resolution doesn't matter much to me, but it would be interesting to know if one display is brighter or has better contrast and viewing angles than the other display. If the Play had a brighter display and / or better contrast, it could actually swing me in that direction.

Been using mine since Friday and no issues at all gaming. If you have any questions or want me to test anything let me know
Posted via the Android Central App

title: How to retain creation date/time on files transferred to my phone?

thread.text:
I have recently gone from one Android phone (HTC) to another (Moto X Play) and now I cannot copy files from my computer to the phone, without my Phone giving them a new Creation Date/Time. I rely on the files being in the special Creation Date/Time sequence I have arranged for them to be in, for a particular App I use, and now they are re is a completely random order, not even filename order, which would have sufficed because my filenames (like most photos) are numbered, so I still know what sequence they in.
I know I could get around it by moving the files one at a time in the sequence I want, but I have on average some 50 odd files in each of 20+ folders, so be blowed if I'm gonna transfer 1,000 files one at a time.
I did some research and discovered this problem had been around ever since Android moved away from the FAT file system to something called Fuse, and developers and the like have been begging for it to be changed and have been ignored.
I generally avoid upgrades to all phones and Apps (and PCs too), because inevitably it stuffs up something I have gotten used to, or changes things I really liked to things I really hate, but I decided to allow my Phone to be upgraded to 6.0 (Marshmallow), in the hope that this problem would be fixed, but NO problem still there.
Furthermore when I look at the Files (All png files) on Windows Explorer it seems to think they are tracks on a CD or something and I just want them to be seen as files.
My HTC phone had neither of this issues, so I assume they were really smart and realised what really dumb idea of Google's this is, and have obviously put their own Patch into their version of the Android system, so it doesn't happen on their phones.
I like lots of things about my new phone, but I am wishing I had stuck with HTC now.
Any chance Motorola (like HTC did), or even better, Google, ever fixing this problem?
Anyone know of a free App I could use to transfer the files in a folder one by one in whatever sequence they are sorted in on my Windows Desktop, so that even though they get a new creation/date time on the phone at least those times will be in the correct sequence? Then I could use my App on my Moto X Play, whereas as it stands I now have to run the App on my old HTC phone and then transfer its output to my new Moto X Play phone. 
Regards Greg

replies.text: Have you tried uploading all the photos to Google Photos? I would think if you did that they would stay in the order you want. Then you could just view them on the app in your phone. They will be stored in the cloud and not on your phone but you will be able to access them from the app.

title: Can the Moto X Play connect with Honda CRV 2015?

thread.text: I bought a new Honda CRV in Sept of 2015 while I had my 2013 Moto X. No problem to connect. Screen was damaged over New Years so I got a new Moto X Play Jan 2016. Now that I try to connect my new phone, the car will not even pick up the presence of my phone. The phone as well will not list the car as a nearby device. Are these two just not compatible? Bluetooth specs are constantly changing, but the phone and car should at least see the other as devices. Bring the car to your dealer's service center and see if they have any firmware updates for the radio.

Sometimes the first time you try to pair two devices it can take a couple of tries and switching Bluetooth off & on in your phone should be enough. You can take a look at this Motorola support page for some recommendations. https://motorola-global-portal.custh...p/30,6720,8696

title: How do I delete contacts on my Moto X Play?

thread.text: deleted contacts continue to appear on the contact list without any data. am unable to purge these from the contact list. can anyone suggest a fix?
Welcome to Android Central! Are these contacts from your Google account, the local Phone account, or some other account?
These are from my phone contacts
Does the phone let you delete the contacts, only to see them come back again? Or does it not even let you delete them?
I can delete the contacts but they come back with no data. When I tap them, I get a msg 'contact does not exist'.

Do you have any other contacts saved to the Phone account that are important? If not, go to Settings>Apps>All, select Contacts and/or Contacts Storage, and Clear Cache/Data. Then open Contacts again, and wait a few seconds for it to sync with your Google Contacts again. Are those annoying contacts still there?
There is no 'All' option after setttings> apps. I have Android 6.0 on my phone. What now?
Oh sorry. Go to Settings>Apps, tap Menu>Show System, and look for Contacts and/or Contacts Storage, then tap Storage, and then Clear Cache and Clear Data there.
Ok. I have done all that and cleared the cache in the contacts storage and rebooted the phone. Guess what? Those contacts are still there??

Are these contacts that you originally entered, or contacts that came with the phone (like customer service contact numbers for Motorola or your carrier)? If so, they're probably baked into the system, and you can't get rid of them.

These are contacts that I entered after I got the phone. It is strange because not all contacts that I delete come back. There are half a dozen contacts which somehow created duplicates and I tried to clean up using duplicate remover app which didnt work, It is these duplicates are proving to be stubborn.
Does your phone have an option to save contacts to the SIM card (instead of the local Phone account)? I wonder if these contacts are somehow on the SIM.
No, there is no option to save it to SIM. It does get synched to the google account. Could the problem be hardware related?

Please clarify--are these reappearing contacts saved to your Google account, or are they on the local Phone account? You had mentioned the "phone contacts" earlier on, and I took this to mean that those contacts were saved to the local Phone account (which doesn't sync to your Google account).

These are contacts that were originally saved to the phone account when the phone had the earlier android version (lollipop). Recently, I have upgratded to marshmellow and now my new contacts are auto synched to google account. This problem of duplicate contacts had occured when the was on lollipop. So I dont think the upgrade caused the problem. Does my old phone contacts now get reflected on the google account?

Phone account contacts wouldn't get synced to your Google account unless you exported them to a vcf file and then imported them into your Google account (or unless you used some 3rd party app to sync).
OK. Thanks. Back to the contact problem. Is there a fix or do I have to live with it?

This is a bit of a puzzling issue. Do you see these contacts when you go to contacts.google.com on your computer browser?

title: How do I disable air wake up?

thread.text: I do not like the air wake up feature. My Moto X Play keeps turning on when I don't want it to and it drains the battery a bit. I can't figure out how to disable it. replies.text: Hi, welcome to the forums! Do you mean the wake up feature every time you pick your phone app or receive a notification? If so, as Hallux said, this is Moto Display on action. Try this. Open your app drawer, search for the Moto app and tap on it, in the Hello screen tap on the three dots/stars top right and select Display. In this screen you can disable this feature or change some settings.

thread.text:
Open the Moto app, in there should be settings that you can adjust to change this behavior. This is a device-specific setting so it's likely adjusted in a manufacturer-supplied app rather than in the regular settings menu.
It may also be in the Active Display options within the settings.

Not unheard of though. A good number of the Motorola DROIDs for Verizon have had "international" variants like the Milestone, Milestone X, RAZR, RAZR HD, RAZR i, and more recently the Moto Maxx which is the current DROID TURBO.

I would love to post pictures but can't post links yet, since I'm new here.
I just want to say that I have experience with DSLR cameras, and I'm fairly critical.
First off the camera software that comes with the phone blows. No touch focus and no ability to change the size (resolution) of pictures. So each one you shoot will be 5-6MB.
After trying a bunch of other apps, I find Google Camera does everything I need for shooting pics. Including being able to change resolution for the back AND front camera. As well as the ability to touch focus.
I find HDR mode helps with low light (if you wish to limit post processing) and low light focusing has been just fine even with macro, and the depth to field has been great.
Overall, for all this phone has to offer, including the price, the camera really has nothing to complain about once you install better software. It should surprise you with what it's capable of.
Just wanted to mention that I got the phone with 5.1 and am currently using 6.
I haven't noticed much difference between the two. I found 5.1 to be quite capable, but I find the battery to drain faster during use with 6. Or I'm just using the phone much more now.....??
Edit: I find the onboard camera to be very good for close-up macro shots, and the Google Camera to be very inconsistent.

Search for "Moto X Play Performance" in XDA, here it doesn't allow me to post links.
In short, i was able to boost the performance to a Moto X 2014 experience:
• Replacing stock rom from CyanogenMod
• Disabling the little CPU cores (using only the first 4 cores)
• Disabling Core Control
• Downgrading to 720 (trust me, is hard to tell the difference with this screen)
• onDemand governor on CM seems to give a smoother experience than interactive.
With that, you have the smoothest Moto X so far.
Other solutions:
If you don't want/can root your phone, just do the 720 downgrade, its easy and can be undone.
If you don't want CM but you can root:
Disabling the little CPU have been reported as doing a huge difference, I bet that doing that and also the 720p should be enough.
